Komite Pemantau Duga Kasus Desa Fiktif di Sultra Libatkan Mafia
07 Nov 2019, 03:00 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Komite Pemantau Duga Kasus Desa Fiktif di Sultra Libatkan Mafia

KBRN, Jakarta : Kasus dugaan puluhan desa fiktif di Kabupaten Konawe, Provinsi Sulawesi Tenggara (Sultra) diduga melibatkan kerja-kerja mafia. Khususnya mafia anggaran.Direktur Eksekutif Komite Pemantauan Pelaksanaan Otonomi Daerah (KPPOD), Robert Andi Jaweng mengatakan, jika merujuk pada amanat Undang-Undang Nomor 6 Tahun 2014 tentang Desa, peraturan pemerintah, peraturan menteri, bahkan sampai peraturan daerah, kasus desa fiktif terbilang mengherankan. Sebab pada dasarnya, proses pembentukan desa bukan mudah layaknya membalikkan telapak tangan."Ini sesuatu yang mengherankan. Karena kalau melihat proses pembentukan desa, sesungguhnya sudah sangat ketat," tegasnya saat berbincang dengan Radio Republik Indonesia, Rabu (6/11/2019).Lebih lanjut dijelaskannya, proses pembentukan desa baru atau pemekaran diawali dengan musyawarah desa yang diikuti oleh masyarakat setempat. Jika disetujui oleh musyawarah desa, hasilnya pun akan di bawa ke tingkat kabupaten oleh pihak kecamatan. Pada tingkat kabupaten akan dibahas bersama DPRD."Karena memang nanti dibentuk di tingkat Perda di tingkat kabupaten," imbuhnya.Sekalipun desa dibentuk oleh Perda di tingkat kabupaten, lanjut Robert, usulan pembentukan desa baru tetap harus melalui konsultasi dengan pihak provinsi."Dan kemudian kalau sudah disahkan dalam bentuk Perda, maka dia akan diberi nomor kode desa oleh Kemendagri," lanjutnya.Maka dari itu, jika melihat rumitnya proses pembentukan desa baru, diduganya kasus desa fiktif merupakan kesalahan dari unsur pemerintah daerah tingkat II. "Saya kira memang teguran keras harus diberikan kepada bupati dan Kepala Dinas Pemberdayaan Masyarakat dan Desa. Karena pasti disana masalahnya," tegasnya.Nah, kalau memang ditemukan adanya kerugian keuangan negara, maka menurut dia, Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) dan Kepolisian harus segera memproses orang-orang yang diduga kuat terlibat. Sebab dia menduga pihak yang terlibat kasus tersebut tergabung dalam jaringan mafia anggaran."Ini memang praktik yang sudah dianggap aksi berburu rente, dan ini kerja yang ga benar. Bahkan cenderung seperti kerja mafia," ketusnya.Perlu diketahui, dugaan tindak pidana korupsi atas pembentukan desa yang tidak sesuai prosedur sah bisa berakibat  pada kerugian keuangan negara atau daerah atas Dana Desa (DD) serta Alokasi Dana Desa (ADD) yang dikelola beberapa desa di Kabupaten Konawe Tahun Anggaran 2016 sampai dengan Tahun Anggaran 2018.Sejauh ini Polda Sultra telah menemukan adanya indikasi 34 desa fiktif di Kabupaten Konawe. Untuk menyelesaikan kasus tersebut, Polda Sultra telah berkoordinasi dengan Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK). (Foto: Tangkap Layar/Berita Satu TV)

The Monitoring Committee for the Fictitious Village Case in Southeast Sulawesi Involved the Mafia
Nov 7 2019, 03:00 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


The Monitoring Committee for the Fictitious Village Case in Southeast Sulawesi Involved the Mafia

KBRN, Jakarta: Cases of alleged dozens of fictitious villages in Konawe Regency, Southeast Sulawesi (Southeast Sulawesi) Province are suspected of involving the work of the mafia. Specifically the budget mafia. Executive Director of the Regional Autonomy Implementation Monitoring Committee (KPPOD), Robert Andi Jaweng said, when referring to the mandate of Law Number 6 of 2014 on Villages, government regulations, ministerial regulations, even local regulations, fictitious village cases are somewhat surprising . Because basically, the process of village formation is not as easy as turning the palm of the hand. "This is something that is surprising. Because when you look at the process of village formation, it is actually very strict," he said when speaking with Radio Republik Indonesia, Wednesday (11/06/2019). He further explained, the process of forming a new village or pemekaran began with a village meeting which was followed by the local community. If agreed by the village meeting, the results will be taken to the district level by the sub-district. At the district level it will be discussed with the DPRD. "Because it will be formed at the district level regulation at the district level," he added. Even though villages were formed by district level regulations, Robert continued, the proposal to form a new village must still go through consultation with the provincial authorities. if it has been ratified in the form of a Perda, then it will be given a village code number by the Ministry of Home Affairs, "he continued. So from that, if you see the complexity of the process of forming a new village, the alleged fictitious village case is the fault of elements of the second level regional government. "I think that a strict reprimand must be given to the regent and the Head of the Community and Village Empowerment Service. Because there must be a problem," he said. Well, if indeed a state financial loss is found, then according to him, the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) and the Police must immediately process people who are allegedly involved. Because he suspects that the parties involved in the case are part of the budget mafia network. "This is indeed a practice that has been considered rent seeking, and this is not true work. It even tends to be like mafia work," he said. villages that are not in accordance with legal procedures can result in state or regional financial losses to the Village Fund (DD) as well as the Village Fund Allocation (ADD) managed by several villages in Konawe District, Fiscal Year 2016 to Fiscal Year 2018. So far the South-East Sulawesi Regional Police have found indication of 34 fictitious villages in Konawe District. To resolve the case, the Southeast Sulawesi Regional Police has coordinated with the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK). (Photo: Screenshot / One TV News)
